did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Papers documenting the career of Lucien L. Nunn.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Electrical engineer. Lucien L. Nunn founded the Telluride Power Company in Telluride, Colorado, and the Telluride Association, a student-managed organization which provides housing and other assistance for intellectually gifted high school and college students at Cornell University and at Deep Springs, California.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Correspondence; photographs and negatives; maps, blueprints, and specifications; clippings; addresses and lectures; printed material; reports; constitution, by-laws, and amendments; financial records; applications; minutes; and other papers documenting the career of Lucien L. Nunn, his founding and direction of the Telluride Association, and the development of the electrical power industry in the United States, including information concerning the Telluride Motor Company, Telluride Power Company, and Ontario Power Company. Also, manuscript history of Telluride by Orville Sweeting. Black and white photographs of Telluride Association Conventions, 1911-1960 and CD with pdf copies of photographs. DVD titled "Hydro Power" from the Rocky Mountain PBS series Colorado Experience, season 2 (2014).
Letters from L.L. Nunn to Wallace Cook.

Family letters, primarily to L. L. Nunn,1863-1938, 1881-1882 (bulk) include original letters, many with typescript transcripts, as well as photocopies. Correspondents include his mother, Miriam Kendall Nunn, his brothers Josiah J. Nunn and Frederick Thomas Nunn, and especially his sister Nellie. 1846 Bible given to L. L. Nunn by his grandmother, Mary Towler Kendall and an 1867 Concordance owned by Nunn. Also, Nunn family genealogy sheets, copies of "snippets" from the diaries of Alice Bird (L. L. Nunn's niece), and three photographs.
Group photographs of members of the Cornell Branch of the Telluride Association, 1910-1960.

descgrp.head: INFORMATION FOR USERS

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Lucien L. Nunn papers, #37-4-1770. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

descgrp.p: Some Telluride Association newsletters and photographs from this collection are available online here: http://ecommons.library.cornell.edu/handle/1813/29989

An extensive amount of additional digitized material, compiled by Denis Clark, regarding Nunn, Telluride Power, Deep Springs and the Telluride Association is available on DVD #809 within this collection. Some of the material is from Cornell, but the DVD also contains files from other sources.

relatedmaterial.head: RELATED MATERIALS
relatedmaterial.p: Related collections: Deep Springs College Records, #6428; Oral History Interviews for Deep Springs College and Telluride Association, #37-4-4042; and John Burchard papers, #6793, http://resolver.library.cornell.edu/cgi-bin/EADresolver?id=RMM06793. See also the book The Electric Edge of Academe.

scopecontent.p:
A number of items from this collection have been digitized and are available online here: http://ecommons.library.cornell.edu/handle/1813/29989
Additionally, an extensive amount of digitized material, compiled by Denis Clark, regarding Nunn, Telluride Power, Deep Springs and the Telluride Association is available on DVD #809 within this collection. Some of the material is from Cornell, but the DVD also contains files from other sources.

scopecontent.p: Includes: "State Historical Landmark No. 514 Pomona Water Plant" (1955), "Ouray: The Gem of the Rockies" (1903), "Adventures in Power: A Fact History of Westinghouse" (1936, two copies with slightly different format), "The Electrical Plant of the Ontario Power Company" (1906), "Allgemeine Elektricitaets-Gesellschaft Berlin" (1893)

did.unittitle: Publications: Scientific Papers Published by Others

scopecontent.p: Includes: "Distribution of Electricity by Secondary Generators" (1887), "Discriminating Lightning Arresters and Recent Progress in Means for Protection Against Lightning" (1894), "Harold P. Brown and the Executioner's Current: an Incident in the AC-DC Controversy" (1958), "The Maximum Distance to which Power can be Economically Transmitted" (1904), "Drop in Alternating Current Lines" (1897), "Polyphase Transmission" (1894), "The Induction Motor and the Rotary Converter and their Relation to the Transmission System" (1901), "Alternating-Current Development in America" (1912)

Excerpt from what was originally issued as disc 5 of the Rocky Mountain PBS series Colorado Experience, season 2. Describes how L.L. Nunn saved the mining business in Telluride, Colorado by financing the Ames Hydroelectric Generating Plant, the first in the world to generate alternating current electric power for industrial purposes. Soon hydroelectric plants appeared across the United States and the world.

scopecontent.p: Shows people and activities at Deep Springs. An index to the negatives is in the back of the book and includes names of those pictured, Including P.N. Nunn, Willsie Martin, Carl S. Patton, Frayne S. Williams, R. G. Baumgardt, Livingston Porter, Carl S. Patton, Anthony F. Blanks, Edna Brush Perkins, Pat Hughes and others. This album has been digitized on CD-2221.
Joe Kershaw, Mary Anne and their son, Harvey and Grace at mine tunnel in Gilbert Pass. Also Clarence Yarrow and Bob Cavenaugh.
CD-1839 with ID's, in accession folder
